message: Private groups aren't and will never be Google indexed.
we'll see how long it takes google to pick that up
on the product i worked on at @sixapart, Movable Type, we made a mistake of trying to offer every option under the sun
and that almost no one fully understood
a required subject, even
I'm still sad @mmalone couldn't get hardknocks.edu :(
It's so easy to add features, we've got to actively resist it working on Convore :)
We want them to be, although right now Google isn't doing a good job of it.
And I don't want to be muddling the message, adding options that could confuse people.
and ended up with a product that took three months to fully regression test
yeah, it's definitely an important class at the school of hard knocks
i should try that, actually
@ericflo yeah, i assumed that.... it would sort of defeat the purpose (:
i was wondering in another thread if there was a use case for a group being public, but not web crawlable
Possibly, but I think the vast majority of the time, people who don't want to be crawled actually want a private group.
forgive me for trying to complicate the product.... i suggest a lot of things just to think through them
No, no it's cool.  I just want to explain my reasoning, and not just shoot it down :)
everyone's had one of those projects :)
i'm still sad i don't work with @mmalone... i miss that guy
i wonder why google doesn't do a good job of searching Convore... is it just because the site is so new, and not linked very much from elsewhere (being still in quasi-stealth mode)
what happens if you put in a totally unique string? does google pick it up eventually?
just created a topic named "booter biddle trizzle cina" which currently has no results in google
yeah, you're probably right
Especially since some crawlers will crawl us even if we ask not to, so then they'll point their finger at us and say "Why is Bing showing up? We told you not to!" etc.
@djchall probably
still hasn't shown up in google
the "six apart update stream" is what it was called
yeah that's a pretty cool feature, http://www.sixapart.com/labs/update/ IIRC, it's totally custom
yeah, i was just reading that page
i remember doing that, to test whether typepad motion posts were getting into the update stream
My "booter biddle trizzle cina" topic https://convore.com/sandbox/booter-biddle-trizzle-cina/
@ericflo at six apart we had a feed of our blogger's entries (and comments, too, i think) that fed into google so they got into search results really fast
i don't know if that is a standard thing, or was something special six apart had
oh, that's right
it's not really very informative
You can just do "curl http://updates.sixapart.com/atom-stream.xml"
Hrm. Have you plugged it into Google's webmaster tools?
I think there is something in there which will tell you how often you'll be indexed, etc.
1290 results in google. Not god awful.
@ericflo I think contrib.sitemap might help?
@justinlilly we've got a sitemap
Yeah, plugged it in and cranked it up to max, it's hitting us at 2 req/sec
You might consider pruning some of those urls though?
unless you think Google will find great value in things like /feedback/info/
I think it'll be different once we get a few inbound links
